dmca.title: Are Keywords the Source of Confusion?
dmca.body:
In the operation of your World Wide Web Site under the domain name www.ham-let.com, your company is using metatags consisting of the trademarks Cajon and Swagelok that are owned and registered by Swaglok.  A copy of your web page's source view dated March 17, 2004 is attached, and clearly shows these trademarks used as "keywords" included in your site.

Your company has not received authorization to use Cajon and Swagelok, nor is your company a reseller or authorized independent distributor of Swagelok products.  In fact, you are a competitor.  Accordingly, you are hereby notified that your company's use of these two Swagelok trademarks is actionable and constitutes trademark infringement, false designation of origin, unfair competition and dilution under the Lanham Act, 15 USC 1051 and the Anti-Cybersquatting Protection Act, 15 USC 1125(d).  Your infringement is actionable under Ohio Common law of infringement, unfair competition, misappropriation and unjust enrichment.

Swagelok hereby demands that your company and its agents, sevants, employees and succcessors and assigns immediately cease and desist from all direct or indirect use of Cajon and Swaglok or any variation thereof, including but not limited to use as a keyword metatag, URL, hypertext link, or registration with Internet search engines.  Expeditious compliance with all terms of this cease and desist letter by your company is expected and shall be made in writing to the undersigned within ten businesss days.
